title: ACL2 : Bans , injuries weaken FC Goa - The Times of India
body_text:
- News
- ACL2: Bans, injuries weaken FC Goa
Margao: So, what next? As of now, there’s nothing, really.FC Goa play the concluding match of their AFC Champions League Two group-stage encounter against Istiklol FC (Tajikistan) at home on Wednesday, without knowing when, or if, they will assemble again for the rest of the season.In normal season, on Christmas Eve, Fatorda would have been bristling with excitement. The stadium would wear a festive look; now the mood will be sombre as the uncertainty over the top-tier Indian Super League (ISL) has left players, coaches, support staff and their families on the edge.“The situation in Indian football is very difficult,” coach Manolo Marquez told TOI at the end of a training session at the Athletic Stadium, Bambolim. “In these circumstances, it’s difficult to motivate the players, but we are professionals and will try to win. Obviously, we won the Super Cup, and now when we are playing at home, in front of our fans, we have to play for pride.”Goa’s campaign in Asian football’s second-tier club competition has been a mixed bag. While they have had encouraging performances, like Al Zawraa and Al-Nassr at home, the all-important points column has remained blank.
End of Article
